document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 171–172. Austroscaeva melanostoma (Macquart, 1842): (171) visiting Euryops pectinatus (L.) Cass, Santiago (photo by Gabriela Germain), and (172) Austroscaeva occidentalis (Shannon, 1927) visiting a flower of Orizoë sp., Ocoa (photo by Daniel Llavaneras).

bibRefCitation.author: Macquart, J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Macquart, J. (1850) Dipteres exotiques nouveaux oupeuconnus. 4 e supplement. Memoirs de la Societe Royale des Sciente, del'Agriculture et des Art, de Lille, 1849, 309 - 479.

bibRefCitation.author: Shannon, R. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Shannon, R. C. (1927) A review of the South American two-winged flies of the family Syrphidae. Proceedings of the United States Natural Museum, 70, 1 - 34. https: // doi. org / 10.5479 / si. 00963801.70 - 2658.1

bibRefCitation.author: Goot, V. S. Van Der
bibRefCitation.refString: Goot, V. S. Van Der (1964) Fluke's catalog of Neotropical Syrphidae (Insects, Diptera) a critical study with an appendix on new names in Syrphidae. Beaufortia, 10, 212 - 221.

.

World distribution. Argentina , Colombia and Chile .
Chilean distribution. From Tarapacá to La Araucanía region ( Fig. 175 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to highland ecosystems (40– 3,750 m .a.s.l.).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 730,507 km 2 , AOO = 108 km 2 and 26 localities (or subpopulations).
